subject: Career
title: Information Brokerage: Connecting Worlds
description: A micro-lesson that makes Information Brokerage: Connecting Worlds usable.

hook.text: She didn't have the most connections. But she connected people who'd never otherwise meet. That was her power.

buildup.text: Information brokers bridge disconnected groups, carrying ideas and opportunities between worlds.

discovery.text: Ron Burt's research shows information brokers generate more creative ideas and advance faster.

twist.text: You don't need a big network to be a broker. You need connections in different clusters.

climax.text: Identify two groups that don't overlap. Introduce key people. You become the bridge â€” and that's power.

punchline.text: The most powerful networker isn't the most connected. It's the best connected.

quiz.question: What is an information broker in network theory?
options: Someone who bridges disconnected groups, carrying ideas between them
